body:
### Problem

As said in the title, on my machine (running gentoo), when TERM=alacritty, nvim does not clear the screen on exit. Vi does, though. When TERM=xterm, it also does clear the screen, but it's considerably slower and i'd rather have alacritty's rendering and not have to hack with terminfo.


### Steps to reproduce

Have alacritty installed.
Build nvim as follows: 

```term
NVIM v0.8.3
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3
Compilation: /usr/bin/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-gcc -march=native -O2 -pipe -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1 -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_MATCH_LIMIT -DNVIM_TS_HAS_SET_ALLOCATOR -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wvla -fstack-protector-strong -fno-common -fdiagnostics-color=always -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -D_GNU_SOURCE -DNVIM_MSGPACK_HAS_FLOAT32 -DNVIM_UNIBI_HAS_VAR_FROM -DMIN_LOG_LEVEL=3 -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.8.3/work/neovim-0.8.3_build/cmake.config -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.8.3/work/neovim-0.8.3/src -I/usr/include -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.8.3/work/neovim-0.8.3_build/src/nvim/auto -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.8.3/work/neovim-0.8.3_build/include
Compiled by portage@localhost

Features: +acl +iconv +tui
```
run nvim command in alacritty 

### Expected behavior

On exit, neovim should clear and ther terminal should resume as if it wasn't open.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

neovim 0.8.3 (luajit)

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

I don't know, but vi does work as expected.

### Operating system/version

Gentoo Linux 

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.11.0

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

Gentoo portage.

these are the currently used termcodes. Is anything out of order? I'm unfamiliar with this concept.

> &term: builtin_ansi

Hmm, is alacritty terminfo missing?

But globally, it is available. I did check /usr/share/terminfo and it is present.
Neovim seems only to process ansi's and kitty's terminfo.

[log.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/10814718/log.txt)

I attached the logfile, because I'm currently unable to copy paste. Hope it is not a bother.

The problem seems to lie in alacritty terminfo not being recognized and defaulting to ansi.
These are the relevant terminfo informations about my system:
``` sh
 ╭─lvx@lambda in ~ via  v3.10.10 took 1m46s
 ╰─λ find /usr/share/terminfo | grep alacritty
/usr/share/terminfo/a/alacritty-direct
/usr/share/terminfo/a/alacritty+common
/usr/share/terminfo/a/alacritty
```

Check to see if the `TERMINFO_DIRS` environment variable is set and what value was set for `TERMINFO_DIRS`(The value given to `-DTERMINFO_DIRS`, not the environment variable) when `unibilium` was built. Perhaps one of those values is inappropriate.

It would appear that my TERMINFO_DIRS is set (probably incorrectly) to /usr/share/st/terminfo, which only includes the st terminfo. I don't know how to change this variable, though. Changing it produces a message stating that it can't find the directory (/usr/share/terminfo). Unibillium is built using the default flags according to it's ebuild. My machine compiles this library too fast for me to check which termifo is actually being passed, but i would assume it to be my system's default.

Managed to obtain it: DTERMINFO_DIRS=\"/etc/terminfo:/usr/share/terminfo\"

This appears to be set correctly.

title: Neovim does not clear screen on exit when TERM=alacritty
